div1.p: In The United States Ciruit Court,For the Ninth Juidicial Circuit, Western Division of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re Ex Parte: Turner Jackson, Petitioner. No. 1325
Petition for Appeal to the Circuit Court of Appeal for the Ninth Circuit, and Order allowing same.
To the Honorable Cornelius H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled Court:

United Staes Marshal for the Western District of Washington, and the United States of America, in the above entitled matter, by its attorney, Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for the Western district of washington; and feeling and deeming themselves aggrieved by the order and judgement of discharge made and entered and filed in the above entitled proceeding on the 11th day of September 1905; do hereby appeal from the said order and judgement of discharge to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and pray that their appeal may be allowed and that a transcript of the record all proceedings and papers upon which said order and judgement was made and entred, duly au- thenticated, may be sent toe th United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit; petitioners respectfully pray that on account thereof their appeal be allowed to crrect the errors complained of and to reverse, annul and set aside the said order and judgement. Your petitioner further pray, that tey have this day filed herein their assignment of errors committed
by the court in this proceeding and intended to be urged by your petitioners as appelants in the prosecution of this suit upon appeal.

Petitioners further show that this appeal is prosecuted by and under the direction and authority of the Attorney Generela of the United States, and on behalf of the United States, and they respectfully pray that said appeal may be allowed without bond. Dated this 12th day if September 1905.
Jesse A Frye, United States Attorney For the Western District of Washington

And now, to-wit, on the 12th day of September 1905; it is ordered that the appeal in the above entitled proceeding to be allowed as prayed by the United Sates Marshal; and it is ordered that siad petitoner, Turner Jackson, may be enlarged pending said appeal upon ten thousand dollars to the satisfaction of the Clerk of this Court for his appearance to answer the judgement of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and upon failure thereof to give bail, to remain in the custody of the Warden of the United States Penitentiary on McNeill's Island, Pierce County, State of Washigtonm until discharged by law. C. H. Hanford, Distrcit Judge of the Western District of Washington
